          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold&quot;&gt;20. DECONSOLIDATION OF SUBSIDIARY&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;On January 15
 2009
 (the &amp;#8220;Closing&amp;#8221;)
 the Company acquired 90% of the capital stock of Olifant U.S.A
 Inc. (&amp;#8220;Olifant&amp;#8221;)
&amp;#160;pursuant to a Stock Purchase Agreement (the &amp;#8220;Agreement. The Company has agreed to pay the sellers $1
200
000 for its 90% interest: $300
000 in cash and common stock valued at $100
000 to be paid 90 days from the Closing date. The initial cash payment of $300
000 which was due 90 days from Closing
 was reduced to $149
633
 which was paid to the sellers in August 2009 together with Company common stock having an aggregate value of $100
000 based on the date of the Agreement.&amp;#160; The Company issued a promissory note for the $800
000 balance. The promissory note is payable in four annual installments
 the first payment is due one year from Closing. Each $200
000 installment is payable $100
000 in cash and Company stock valued at $100
000 with the
          stock value based on the 30 trading days immediately prior to the installment date. The cash portion of the note accrues interest at a rate of 5% per annum. On January 15
 2010
 the Company paid the first loan installment in the amount of $200
000 and $5
000 in interest. The Company issued 1
320 shares as payment for the stock portion of the installment
 and at the election of the sellers
 $63
000 in cash and 554&amp;#160;in common stock as payment of the cash and interest portion on the first installment.&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 2012
 the Company agreed to return 42% of the capital stock of Olifant&amp;#160;reducing ownership interest to 48%
 in exchange for the cancellation of the outstanding debt obligation and related accrued interest.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;As a result of the transaction
 the Company no longer has a controlling interest in Olifant
 as such
 the Company recorded a gain on the deconsolidation of $280
483. The investment for their remaining 48% interest is $0 since Olifant has an accumulated deficit and a deficit in equity.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;

        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold&quot;&gt;21. CUSTOMER CONCENTRATION&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 2013

 of the Company&apos;s sales
 respectively. For the year ended April 30
 2012
 one customer accounted for 18% of the Company&apos;s sales.&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The Company&amp;#8217;s national spirits sales are generally done through the top five spirits and wine distributing companies in the nation
 Glazers
 Southern Wine and Spirits
 Republic National Distributing Company
 Johnson Brothers Distributing Company and Youngs Market. The Company&amp;#8217;s beer business is done primarily through a network of Anheuser Busch and Miller and Coors Brewing company distributors in 15 states.&lt;/font&gt;

  
  
  

        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold&quot;&gt;22. COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold&quot;&gt;Operating lease&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;On December 21
 2011
 the Company entered into a five-year lease for office space in Ridgefield
 CT with monthly base lease payments are $2
565 for year one and two
 $2
782
 $2
853 and $2
967 for years three
 four and five
 respectively. The Company received a rent credit of $7
696 in each of the months of March 2012
 April 2012 and May 2012. The lease agreement was terminated in April 2013.&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 the Company entered into a month-to-month lease for office space in Simi Valley
 California with monthly base lease payments of $3
500. The Company has moved its corporate headquarters to 4101 Whiteside
 Los Angeles
 CA as of the date of this filing on a month-to-month basis of $ 5
000.00.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Rent expense charged to operations
 which differs from rent paid due to the rent credits and to increasing amounts of base rent
 is calculated by allocating total rental payments on a straight-line basis over the term of the lease. During the years ended April 30

243

735
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold&quot;&gt;License Agreement&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 the Company received a notice of termination of the Licensing Agreement for all tequila
 including KAH
 originally dated June 27
 2011 and subsequently amended on November 1
 2011 and August 30
 2012
 for non-payment of outstanding account payables. All shipments of product ended in January 2013.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
          &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
              &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;On March 1&lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top&quot;&gt;st&lt;/font&gt;
 2013 Worldwide Beverage Imports (&amp;#8220;WBI&amp;#8221;) and Drinks Americas Holdings
 Inc. (&amp;#8220;Broker&amp;#8221;) entered into a 1-year
 automatically renewing brokerage agreement giving DKAM the license to act as a broker of beer and spirits and possesses the necessary local
 state and federal licenses and permits authorizing it to act in such capacity for the WBI.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Compensation shall be based&amp;#160;on a percentage of &amp;#8220;Net Sales&amp;#8221;
 with&lt;/font&gt; &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;an advance monthly fee of $5
000 for services rendered monthly to be paid by&lt;/font&gt; &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;WBI to Broker&amp;#8217;s affiliated sales agent Osirius
 including reimbursement for health&lt;/font&gt; &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;insurance
 and travel expenses submitted each time travel reaches total of $3
000.&lt;/font&gt; &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;A commission rate of $0.50 (fifty cents) per case for all case sales of beer
 including brands such as Rio Bravo
 Day of the Dead
 and others
 as they are sold in the US and Canada.&lt;/font&gt;
            &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

          &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold&quot;&gt;Litigation&lt;/font&gt;
          &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline&quot;&gt;On June 18
 2010
 Socius CG II
 Ltd.
 (&amp;#8220;Socius&amp;#8221;)
 a creditor of the Company due to its purchase of various claims from other various creditors of the Company (&amp;#8220;Creditor Claims&amp;#8221;)
 filed a Complaint against the Company in the Supreme Court of the State of New York (the &amp;#8220;Court&amp;#8221;) for breach of contract to recover on the Creditor Claims (the &amp;#8220;Socius Action&amp;#8221;). On July 29
 2010
 the Company entered into a settlement agreement with Socius pursuant to which the Company issued approximately 10
350 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock (the &amp;#8220;Settlement Shares&amp;#8221;) in exchange for satisfaction of the Creditor Claims totaling $334
006 (the &amp;#8220;Settlement&amp;#8221;).&amp;#160; In November 2011
 Socius moved the Court for a Preliminary Injunction and Contempt Order (the &amp;#8220;Socius Motion&amp;#8221;)
            alleging that the Company had failed to comply the terms of the Settlement when
 in sum
 the Company had issued an insufficient number of Settlement Shares.&amp;#160; Through Company and non-party affidavits and Memorandum of Law
 the Company vigorously opposed the facts and legal arguments set forth in the Socius Motion (collectively
 the &amp;#8220;Opposition&amp;#8221;).&amp;#160; On February 28
 2012
 the parties entered into a Stipulation of Settlement
 which the Court &amp;#8220;so Ordered&amp;#8221; (the &amp;#8220;Stipulation&amp;#8221;).&amp;#160; Pursuant to the Stipulation
 the Company paid Socius $27
635.87 and agreed to satisfy all unpaid Creditor Claims in the aggregate amount of $109
474.77.&amp;#160; Additionally
 pursuant to the Stipulation
 Socius surrendered for cancellation 13.837 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s Series B Preferred Stock
 representing all issued and outstanding Series B Preferred Stock of the Company
 and warrants to purchase 35
605 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock
            representing all warrants issued to Socius&amp;#8217; affiliate pursuant to that certain Preferred Stock Purchase Agreement
 dated August 17
 2009.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
          &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline&quot;&gt;Niche Media v. Drinks Americas
 Inc.&lt;/font&gt;
 Connecticut Superior Court of the Judicial District of Stamford Norwalk at Stamford.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In this action
 Plaintiff filed suit for unpaid advertising and claimed approximately $130
000 plus accruing interest and attorney fees.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In March 2011
 the case was settled and the Plaintiff withdrew the case in exchange for the Company&apos;s agreement to pay $90
000 over 29 months commencing June 2011.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Balance due and accrued under this agreement as of April 30
 2013 and 2012 was $42
000 and $54
800
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline&quot;&gt;Westchester Surplus Lines Insurance Company v. Drinks Americas Waters
 LLC d/b/a Drinks Americas
 Inc.
&lt;/font&gt; Connecticut Superior Court for Judicial District of New Haven at Hen Haven
 Docket Number NNH-CV 11-6025054S.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In this action
 Plaintiff filed suit for unpaid insurance premiums and claims approximately $25
000.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Company believes this claim is without merit and will defend vigorously.&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline&quot;&gt;Wenneker Distilleries v. Olifant USA
 Inc. and Drinks America
 Inc.
&lt;/font&gt; United States District Court
 Middle District of Pennsylvania.&lt;font style=&quot;FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;In this action
 the Plaintiff filed suit for unjust enrichment stemming directly from a stock purchase agreement entered into by Olifant USA
 Inc. and Drinks Americas
 Inc on January 15
 2009 and unpaid dues to the Plaintiff for goods delivered to Olifant USA
 Inc. in 2008.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The total amount sought from Drinks Americas
 Inc. is $225
894.34 plus interest and cost.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company believes this claim is without merit and will defend vigorously.&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;font style=&quot;FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline&quot;&gt;Jeffrey Daub.&lt;/font&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;This matter involves a claim by Jeffrey Daub
 an ex-employee
 for payment of deferred salary.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The matter was settled with the Plaintiff agreeing to a payment plan containing fourteen payments with the final payment due September 1
 2012 for a total of $140
000.&amp;#160;Balance due and accrued under this agreement as of April 30
 2013 and 2012 was $27
500 and $55
000
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline&quot;&gt;In the Matter of Liquor Group Holding
 LLC v. Drinks Americas Holdings
 Ltd&lt;/font&gt;. (American Arbitration Association).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;On March 7
 2011
 the Company successfully obtained an arbitration award in its favor in the sum $664
659.05 after filing a counterclaim against Liquor Group Holding
 LLC. The Company is currently exploring avenues for collection of the arbitration award.&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline&quot;&gt;Drinks Americas Holdings
 Ltd. / Pabst Brewing Company&lt;/font&gt; (relating to the Company&amp;#8217;s license to Rheingold beer). On April 10
 2012
 Pabst Brewing Company (&amp;#8220;Pabst&amp;#8221;) issued a notice of default and subsequently issued a notice of termination and a cease and desist letter with respect to that certain License Agreement between the Company and Pabst
 dated August 22
 1997
 as amended. The Company responded rejecting the aforesaid notices and disputing the alleged default. The Company does not believe that Pabst has any valid legal grounds to terminate the Rheingold beer license. Negotiations with Pabst have ensued and are continuing. There is a likelihood that litigation will be commenced if Pabst refuses to withdraw its default
 termination and cease and desist notices.&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline&quot;&gt;Drinks Americas
 Inc. / Samuel Bailey
 Jr.
 et al&lt;/font&gt;. On April 5
 2012 Drinks Americas
 Inc. filed a civil suit against three defendants
 Samuel Bailey
 Jr.
 Paul Walraven and Jack McKenzie in the Judicial District of Stamford
 Connecticut (Docket Number FST-CV-11-6011590).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Drinks claims that the parties breached a certain Settlement Agreement and General Release
 dated
 August 10
 2009 for failure to deliver shares of stock in Olifant USA
 Inc. to Drinks
 notwithstanding the receipt by the defendants from Drinks of a $75
000 cash payment and $20
000 worth of Drinks&amp;#8217; stock.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The defendants do not dispute the receipt of the said $75
000 cash payment and $20
000 worth of stock but dispute Drinks&amp;#8217; claims that they owe any money or stock.&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Other than the items discussed above
 we believe that the Company is currently not subject to litigation
 which
 in the opinion of our management
 is likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.&lt;/font&gt;

        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold&quot;&gt;23.&amp;#160; FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENT&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The Company adopted the provisions of Accounting Standards Codification subtopic 825-10
 Financial Instruments (&amp;#8220;ASC 825-10&amp;#8221;) on January 1
 2008. ASC 825-10 defines fair value as the price that would be received from selling an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date. When determining the fair value measurements for assets and liabilities required or permitted to be recorded at fair value
 the Company considers the principal or most advantageous market in which it would transact and considers assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or liability
 such as inherent risk
 transfer restrictions
 and risk of nonperformance. ASC 825-10 establishes a fair value hierarchy that requires an entity to maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable inputs when
          measuring fair value. ASC 825-10 establishes three levels of inputs that may be used to measure fair value:&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Level 1 - Quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities.&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Level 2 - Observable inputs other than Level 1 prices such as quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities; quoted prices in markets with insufficient volume or infrequent transactions (less active markets); or model-derived valuations in which all significant inputs are observable or can be derived principally from or corroborated by observable market data for substantially the full term of the assets or liabilities.&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Level 3 - Unobservable inputs to the valuation methodology that are significant to the measurement of fair value of assets or liabilities.&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;To the extent that valuation is based on models or inputs that are less observable or unobservable in the market
 the determination of fair value requires more judgment. In certain cases
 the inputs used to measure fair value may fall into different levels of the fair value hierarchy. In such cases
 for disclosure purposes
 the level in the fair value hierarchy within which the fair value measurement is disclosed and is determined based on the lowest level input that is significant to the fair value measurement.&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The carrying value of the Company&amp;#8217;s cash and cash equivalents
 accounts receivable
 accounts payable
 short-term borrowings (Including convertible notes payable)
 and other current assets and liabilities approximate fair value because of their short-term maturity.&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;As of April 30
 2013
 the Company has convertible promissory notes with embedded derivatives that are recorded and measured at fair value on a recurring basis in the accompanying consolidated financial statements. Convertible notes were determined at market based on their short-term historical conversions.&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The following table provides a summary of changes in fair value of the Company&amp;#8217;s Level 3 financial liabilities as of April 30
 2013:&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=&quot;0&quot; cellspacing=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;75%&quot; style=&quot;FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman&quot;&gt;
            &lt;tr&gt;
              &lt;td align=&quot;left&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;61%&quot; style=&quot;PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px&quot;&gt;
                &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;
              &lt;/td&gt;
              &lt;td align=&quot;right&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px&quot;&gt;
                &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;
              &lt;/td&gt;
              &lt;td colspan=&quot;2&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;12%&quot; style=&quot;BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid&quot;&gt;
                &lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;center&quot;&gt;
                  &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold&quot;&gt;Derivative&lt;/font&gt;
                &lt;/div&gt;
                &lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;center&quot;&gt;
                  &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold&quot;&gt;Liability&lt;/font&gt;
                &lt;/div&gt;
              &lt;/td&gt;
              &lt;td align=&quot;left&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px&quot;&gt;
                &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;
              &lt;/td&gt;
            &lt;/tr&gt;
            &lt;tr style=&quot;background-color: #CCEEFF;&quot;&gt;
              &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;61%&quot;&gt;
                &lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
                  &lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;
                    &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Balance
 April 30
 2011&lt;/font&gt;
                  &lt;/div&gt;
                &lt;/div&gt;
              &lt;/td&gt;
              &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;
                &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;
              &lt;/td&gt;
              &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;
                &lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
                  &lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
                    &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;
                  &lt;/div&gt;
                &lt;/div&gt;
              &lt;/td&gt;
              &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;11%&quot;&gt;
                &lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
                  &lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;right&quot;&gt;
                    &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;31
186&lt;/font&gt;
                  &lt;/div&gt;
                &lt;/div&gt;
              &lt;/td&gt;
              &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;

              &lt;/td&gt;
            &lt;/tr&gt;
            &lt;tr&gt;
              &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;61%&quot;&gt;
                &lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
                  &lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;
                    &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Total (gains) losses&lt;/font&gt;
                  &lt;/div&gt;
                &lt;/div&gt;
              &lt;/td&gt;
              &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;

              &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;

                &lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
                  &lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;right&quot;&gt;
                    &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;-&lt;/font&gt;
                  &lt;/div&gt;
                &lt;/div&gt;
              &lt;/td&gt;
              &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;
                &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;
              &lt;/td&gt;
            &lt;/tr&gt;
            &lt;tr style=&quot;background-color: #CCEEFF;&quot;&gt;
              &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;61%&quot;&gt;
                &lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;

          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;During the year ended April 30
 2013
 the Company entered into convertible notes with embedded derivatives that required the bifurcation and marking to fair value the derivative liability.&lt;/font&gt;

        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold&quot;&gt;24. SUBSEQUENT EVENTS&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline&quot;&gt;Common Stock&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;On May 1
 2013
 the Company issued 3
125
000 restricted shares of its common stock to a Joseph Belli for services rendered valued at $7
500. The fair value of the shares issued was $93
750 based on the quoted market price of the shares at the time of issuance.&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;On May 1
 2013
 the Company issued 3
125
000 restricted shares of its common stock to a Kyle Reinholm for services rendered valued at $7
500. The fair value of the shares issued was $93
750 based on the quoted market price of the shares at the time of issuance.&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;On May 1
 2013
 the Company issued 25
000
000 restricted shares of its common stock to a John Sokol for services rendered valued at $60
000. The fair value of the shares issued was $750
000 based on the quoted market price of the shares at the time of issuance.&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;On May 1
 2013
 the Company issued 10
416
667 restricted shares of its common stock to a Leonard Moreno for services rendered valued at $25
000. The fair value of the shares issued was $312
500 based on the quoted market price of the shares at the time of issuance.&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;On May 1
 2013
 the Company issued 9
375
000 restricted shares of its common stock to Timothy J. Owens
 the CEO of the Company
 for services rendered valued at $22
500. The fair value of the shares issued was $281
250 based on the quoted market price of the shares at the time of issuance.&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;On August 1
 2013
 the Company issued 9
375
000 restricted shares of its common stock to Timothy J. Owens
 the CEO of the Company
 for services rendered valued at $22
500.&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;On August 1
 2013
 the Company issued 3
125
000 restricted shares of its common stock to a Kyle Reinholm for services rendered valued at $7
500.&lt;/font&gt;

          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline&quot;&gt;Preferred Stock&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;On August 20
 2014
 the Company entered into a Letter Agreement with Worldwide Beverage Imports
 LLC.
 pursuant to which WBI agreed to forgive $100
000 of payables owed by the Company to WBI in exchange for the Company&amp;#8217;s issuance to WBI of 10
000 shares of newly designated preferred stock that holds voting rights equal to 230
000 votes per share.&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;In consideration for and as an inducement to enter into the Amendment
 on August 21
 2014 the Company issued to WBI 10
000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s newly created Series E Preferred.&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;On August 21
 2014
 the Company filed a Certificate of Designation of Series E Preferred Stock with the Secretary of State of Delaware. Pursuant to the Certificate of Designation
 15
000 shares of preferred stock were designated Series E Preferred Stock
 which Series E Preferred Stock holds no conversion rights or rights to dividends. The Series E Preferred Stock will vote as a single class with the common stock and the holders of the Series E Preferred Stock will have the number of votes equal to 230
000 times the number of shares of Series E Preferred Stock. Upon liquidation
 the holders of the Series E Preferred Stock will have the right to receive
 prior to any distribution with respect to the common stock
 but subject to the rights of the holders of the Series A Preferred Stock
 Series B Preferred Stock
 Series C Preferred Stock and Series D Preferred Stock
 the Stated Value (plus any other
          fees or liquidated damages payable thereon).&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline&quot;&gt;Debentures&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 2013
 the Company issued
 in lieu of cash payment for past due accounts payables equal to $670
000
 a convertible debenture to Worldwide Beverage Imports
 LLC. in the aggregate principal amount of $ 670
000.&amp;#160;The debenture accrues interest at 8% per annum. The debenture
 which includes all principal and interest
 are due in full on November 1
 2013. The debenture is convertible
 at the option of the holder
 into shares of common stock of the Company at the lesser of (i) the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on November 2
 2013; or (ii) the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date immediately prior to the date the holder of the debenture requests their conversion.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;However
 in the event of a default under the debenture
 the debenture will be convertible at a 38%
          discount to market.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 2013
 the Company issued
 in lieu of cash payment for past due accounts payables equal to $26
423
 a convertible debenture to Darrin Ocasio in the aggregate principal amount of $26
423.&amp;#160;The debenture accrues interest at 8% per annum. The debenture
 which includes all principal and interest
 are due in full on May 1
 2014. The debenture is convertible
 at the option of the holder
 into shares of common stock of the Company at the greater of (i) the par value of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock; or (ii) 50% of the average closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock for the 10 days prior to the date the holder of the debenture requests their conversion.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;There is a mandatory conversion provision if the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock exceeds $2.00 per share for 10 consecutive trading
          days.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In the event of default
 the conversion price is changed to a variable conversion price which equals 62% of the average of the lowest 3 closing prices 10 days prior to the conversion date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 2013
 the Company issued
 in lieu of cash payment for past due accounts payables equal to $14
000
 a convertible debenture to Steve Chaussy in the aggregate principal amount of $14
000.&amp;#160;The debenture accrues interest at 6% per annum. The debenture
 which includes all principal and interest
 are due in full on November 1
 2013. The debenture is convertible
 at the option of the holder
 into shares of common stock of the Company at the lesser of (i) the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on the date of issuance; or (ii) the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock prior to the conversion date.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;There is a mandatory conversion provision if the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock exceeds $2.00 per share for 10 consecutive trading days.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In the event of default
 the conversion
          price is changed to a variable conversion price which equals 70% of the average of the lowest 3 closing prices 10 days prior to the conversion date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 2014
 the Company issued

000 in August 2013
 $70
000 in October 2013
 $150

000 in January 2014).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Convertible Debentures accrue interest at 8% per annum. The $35

 2014.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The $70
000 Convertible Debenture matures on October 31
 2014.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The $150
000 Convertible Debenture matures on May 26
 2014.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The $200
000 Convertible Debenture matures on July 7
 2014.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 at the option of the holder
 into shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock at a conversion price equal to 35% of the lowest trading price of Common Stock for the 24 months preceding their original issuance dates.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;However
 in the event of a default under the Convertible Debentures
 the Convertible Debentures will be convertible at a 75% discount to the average of the three lowest trading prices of the ten trading days prior to such conversion.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In no event may the Convertible Notes be converted at a conversion price below the par value of Common Stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;

 2014 and March 11
 2014
 the Company issued two convertible debentures (each a &amp;#8220;Convertible Debenture&amp;#8221; and collectively
 the &amp;#8220;Convertible Debentures&amp;#8221;) to a third party investor (the &amp;#8220;Investor&amp;#8221;) in the aggregate principal amount of $255

 2014.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The $130
000 Convertible Debenture matures on September 11
 2014. The Convertible Debentures are convertible
 at the option of the holder

          for the 24 months preceding their original issuance dates.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;However
 in the event of a default under the Convertible Debentures
 the Convertible Debentures will be convertible at a 75% discount to the average of the three lowest trading prices of the ten trading days prior to such conversion.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In no event may the Convertible Notes be converted at a conversion price below the par value of Common Stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 2014 and on March 11
 2014

000 and $130
000

 2013.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Notes were originally issued to World Wide Beverage Imports
 LLC (&amp;#8220;WBI&amp;#8221;) on November 1
 2012.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;WBI assigned the Notes to a third party from whom IBC acquired the Notes. Pursuant to the Amendments
 IBC agreed to extend the maturity of the Notes from May 1
 2013 to March 6
 2015 and March 11
 2015 and to waive
 if any
 existing or prior defaults under the Notes and the Company agreed to (i) amend the conversion price of the
          Notes to the equal 35% of the lowest historical traded price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 2014
 the Company issued a convertible unsecured promissory note (the &quot;Note&quot;) to a third party investor (the &amp;#8220;Investor&amp;#8221;) in the aggregate principal amount of $50
000.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Note accrues interest at 8% per annum.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Note matures December 12
 2014. The Note is convertible
 at the option of the holder
 into shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock
 par value $0.001 per share (&amp;#8220;Common Stock&amp;#8221;) at a conversion price equal to the greater of (i) the par value of Common Stock or (ii) 35% of the lowest trading price of Common Stock for the 24 months preceding their original issuance dates
 which correspond to the dates on which the respective portion of the Aggregate Purchase Price was received by the Company.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;However
 in the event of a default under the Note
 the
          Note will be convertible at a 75% discount to the average of the three lowest trading prices of the ten trading days prior to such conversion.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In no event may the Note be converted at a conversion price below the par value of Common Stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 2014
 the Company entered into first amendments with Tide Pool Ventures Corporation (&amp;#8220;Tide Pool&amp;#8221;) to certain convertible promissory notes in an aggregate principal amount of $200
000
 which notes were originally dated November 1
 2012.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The notes were originally issued to Worldwide Beverage Imports on November 1
 2012 and subsequently assigned to a third party investor whom Tide Pool acquired these notes. Pursuant to the amendment
 Tide Pool agreed to extend the maturity until the first anniversary of the amendments and the Company agreed to amend the notes to include the conversion pricing at 38% of the average of the lowest 3 closing bid prices 10 days prior to the conversion date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 2014
 the Company issued four convertible promissory notes to a third party investor.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The notes bear interest at 8% per annum and contain an original issue discount of 20%.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The notes mature 1 year from the date of issuance.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 2013
 Mr. Charles Menzies
 tendered his resignation from the Board of Directors of the Company
 effective immediately.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Mr. Menzies&amp;#8217; resignation was not as a result of any disagreements with the Company&amp;#8217;s operations
 policies or practices.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 2013
 the Circuit Court in the 12th Judicial Circuit in and for Sarasota County
 Florida (the &amp;#8220;Court&amp;#8221;)
 entered an Order Granting Approval of Settlement Agreement (the &amp;#8220;Order&amp;#8221;) approving
 among other things
 the fairness of the terms and conditions of an exchange pursuant to Section 3(a)(10) of the Securities Act of 1933
 as amended (the &amp;#8220;Securities Act&amp;#8221;)
 in accordance with a Settlement Agreement (the &amp;#8220;Settlement Agreement&amp;#8221;) between Drinks Americas Holdings
 Ltd. (the &amp;#8220;Company&amp;#8221;) and IBC Funds
 LLC
 a Nevada limited liability company (&amp;#8220;IBC&amp;#8221;)
 in the matter entitled IBC Funds
 LLC v. Drinks Americas Holdings
 Ltd.
 Case No. 2013 CA 5705 (the &amp;#8220;Action&amp;#8221;). IBC commenced the Action against the Company to recover $327
131.65 of an
          unpaid Convertible Debenture of the Company
 which IBC had purchased from the Company on October 15
 2012 (the &amp;#8220;Claim&amp;#8221;). The Order provides for the full and final settlement of the Claim and the Action. The Settlement Agreement became effective and binding upon the Company and IBC upon execution of the Order by the Court on July 26
 2013.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 on July 26
 2013
 the Company agreed to issue
 in one or more tranches as necessary
 that number of shares equal to $197
630.64 upon conversion to the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock
 $0.001 par value (the &amp;#8220;Common Stock&amp;#8221;) at a conversion rate equal to 35% of the lowest historical traded price of the Common Stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 when aggregated with all other shares of Common Stock then beneficially owned by IBC and its affiliates (as calculated pursuant to Section 13(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934
 as amended (the &amp;#8220;Exchange Act&amp;#8221;)
 and the rules and regulations thereunder)
 result in the beneficial ownership by IBC and its affiliates (as calculated pursuant to Section 13(d) of the Exchange Act and the rules and regulations thereunder) at any time of more than 9.99% of the Common Stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 the Settlement Agreement provides that
 for so long as IBC or any of its affiliates hold any shares of Common Stock
 the Company and its affiliates are prohibited from
 among other actions
 voting any shares of Common Stock owned or controlled by the Company or its affiliates
 or soliciting any proxies or seeking to advise or influence any person with respect to any voting securities of the Company
 in favor of: (1) an extraordinary corporate transaction
 such as a merger
 reorganization or liquidation
 involving Company or any of its subsidiaries
 (2) a sale or transfer of a material amount of assets of Company or any of its subsidiaries
 (3) any change in the present board or management of the Company
 including any plans or proposals to change the number or term of directors or to fill any existing vacancies
          on the board
 (4) any material change in the present capitalization or dividend policy of Company
 (5) any other material change in Company&amp;#8217;s business or corporate structure
 (6) a change in Company&amp;#8217;s charter
 bylaws or instruments corresponding thereto (7) causing a class of securities of the Company to be delisted from a national securities exchange or to cease to be authorized to be quoted in an inter-dealer quotation system of a registered national securities association
 (8) causing a class of equity securities of Company to become eligible for termination of registration pursuant to Section 12(g)(4) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934
 as amended
 (9) terminating the Company&amp;#8217;s transfer agent (10) taking any action which would impede the purposes and objects of the Settlement Agreement&amp;#160;&amp;#160;or (11) taking any action
 intention
 plan or arrangement similar to any of those enumerated above.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 as an issuance of securities in exchange for bona fide outstanding claims
 where the terms and conditions of such issuance are approved by a court after a hearing upon the fairness of such terms and conditions at which all persons to whom it is proposed to issue securities in such exchange shall have the right to appear.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 2014
 the Circuit Court in the 12th Judicial Circuit in and for Sarasota County
 Florida (the &amp;#8220;Court&amp;#8221;)
 entered an Order Granting Approval of Settlement Agreement (the &amp;#8220;Order&amp;#8221;) approving
 among other things

          $455
000.00 (the &amp;#8220;Claim&amp;#8221;)
 which Claim consists of the Notes (as defined below). The Order provides for the full and final settlement of the Claim and the Action. The Settlement Agreement became effective and binding upon the Company and IBC upon execution of the Order by the Court on March 7

        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 in one or more tranches as necessary

        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

 and the rules and regulations thereunder)
 result in the beneficial ownership by IBC and its affiliates (as calculated pursuant to Section 13(d) of the Exchange Act and the rules and regulations thereunder) at any time of more than 9.99% of the Common Stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;

							function toggleNextSibling (e) {
							if (e.nextSibling.style.display=='none') {
							e.nextSibling.style.display='block';
							} else {
							e.nextSibling.style.display='none';
							}
							}

							function toggleNextSibling (e) {
							if (e.nextSibling.style.display=='none') {
							e.nextSibling.style.display='block';
							} else {
							e.nextSibling.style.display='none';
							}
							}

							function toggleNextSibling (e) {
							if (e.nextSibling.style.display=='none') {
							e.nextSibling.style.display='block';
							} else {
							e.nextSibling.style.display='none';
							}
							}

							e.nextSibling.style.display='block';

							}

							function toggleNextSibling (e) {
							if (e.nextSibling.style.display=='none') {
							e.nextSibling.style.display='block';
							} else {
							e.nextSibling.style.display='none';
							}
							}

 including discontinued operations. Operating activity cash flows include transactions

}

	display: block;
	font-weight: bold;
}

	margin-top: 0px;

}

	background-color: #2F4497;
}

	height: 150px;
	overflow: auto;
	width: 400px;
}

	font-size: 1em;
}

	color: black;
	text-decoration: none;

}
..report td.pl a:hover {
	background-color: #ffc;
}
/* Header rows... */
..report tr.rh {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
}
/* Calendars... */
..report .rc {
	background-color: #f0f0f0;
}
/* Even rows... */
..report .re
 .report .reu {
	background-color: #def;
}
..report .reu td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}
/* Odd rows... */
..report .ro
 .report .rou {
	background-color: white;
}
..report .rou td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}
..report .rou table td
 .report .reu table td {
	border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}
/* styles for footnote marker */
..report .fn {
	white-space: nowrap;
}
/* styles for numeric types */
..report .num
 .report .nump {
	text-align: right;
	white-space: nowrap;
}
..report .nump {
	padding-left: 2em;
}
..report .nump {
	padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}
/* styles for text types */
..report .text {
	text-align: left;
	white-space: normal;
}
..report .text .big {
	margin-bottom: 1em;
	width: 17em;
}
..report .text .more {
	display: none;
}
..report .text .note {
	font-style: italic;
	font-weight: bold;
}
..report .text .small {
	width: 10em;
}
..report sup {
	font-style: italic;
}
..report .outerFootnotes {
	font-size: 1em;
}

							function toggleNextSibling (e) {
							if (e.nextSibling.style.display=='none') {
							e.nextSibling.style.display='block';
							} else {
							e.nextSibling.style.display='none';
							}
							}
